oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery On The Record with Lorrie Morgan - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Lorrie Morgan (performer) for Ralph Emery: On the Record With Lorrie Morgan. The recording is performed in front of a live audience. The recording is from January 13, 1995. The tape is labeled part 1.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Lorrie Morgan
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Doug Stone and an unidentified voice present Lorrie Morgan the Female Artist of the Year Award -- (01:35) Ralph Emery introduces Morgan while listing Morgan's accomplishments -- (02:33) Emery asks if Morgan truly believed Stone was joking about giving Morgan the Female Artist of the Year Award; additionally, Emery inquires about Morgan's thoughts about the difficulties of being a female artist [explicit] -- (07:33) Emery inquires about the sexual exploitation Morgan faced -- (08:37) Emery recalls a time where a time where Morgan's publication did not like her look on Nashville Now -- (10:38) Emery asks Morgan if she believes she alienated women -- (13:03) Emery inquires about the first time Morgan visited the Grand Ole Opry -- (15:19) Paper Roses [excerpt] (Lorrie Morgan) -- (15:43) Emery reflects on how George Morgan was celebrated on stage the same night of the Grand Ole Opry Show -- (17:19) Emery plays a video of George Morgan's last performance of "Candy Kisses" on the Grand Ole Opry -- (17:56) Emery reflects on the Ryman Auditorium, and Morgan recalls being on a date at the Ryman Auditorium -- (19:46) Candy Kisses [except] (Lorrie Morgan) -- (20:31) Morgan is asked about her family and George Morgan's "Put All Your Love in a Cookie Jar" -- (22:13) Morgan reveals her real name was Loretta Lynn, and Emery asks Morgan to recall when the two had started working together -- (24:24) Emery inquires about the 'pretend' show Morgan performed as a child -- (28:22) Emery asks Morgan about her audition for the Grand Ole Opry -- (30:01) Emery recalls moving to the Nashville Now Show and bringing Morgan with him; additionally, Emery graphs out the road that Morgan took to RCA Records -- (32:53) Emery inquires about the success of Morgan's various albums -- (33:39) Emery plays a tape of the time Morgan had a party for her first gold album -- (33:47) Morgan reflects on her lack of confidence during the early stages of her career -- (35:27) Morgan reflects on the time where she worked with George Jones during his alcoholism -- (39:08) Emery recalls how he read that Jones had given Morgan advice; additionally, Emery inquires about Morgan's failed marriages
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Morgan, Lorrie;
